snippet: Alternative models, which base their assessment on data from other sources like cable and cellphone bills, are being tried by TransUnion and Fair Isaac.
abstract: Ann Carrns Your Money Adviser column says credit reporting industry is beginning to use alternative credit scores that could allow open lending to more consumers; questions and answers about alternative credit scoring provided.
lead_paragraph: Alternative models, which base their assessment on data from other sources like cable and cellphone bills, are being tried by TransUnion and Fair Isaac.

headline.print_headline: New Credit Score Systems Could Open Lending to More Consumers
headline.main: New Credit Score Systems Could Open Lending to More Consumers
